comment: Do not buy the textbook!!!! You just have to read the slides he posts online and put in minimal effort to get an A in this class. Easiest professor Ive had all semester. Class was boring, but youll get through it.

There are 3 exams based on how well you did (50%, 30%, 20%). There are also 10 points of extra credit available on your final grade for those attending class. I highly recommend going to class and doing the practice questions in the book to get an A. He really encouraged asking questions if you were confused. He wanted students to perform well.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Show up whenever he randomly gives an EASYYYYY quiz (up to 5 throughout the semester) and hell give you 10 pts on your overall grade. Ppl saying his lectures are confusing probably arent taking advantage of showing up to class and expect to just learn from the slides that he was nice enough to post online. Theyre hand in hand to the lecture..
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easy A professor, only 3 tests adjusted from highest to lowest grade (50%, 30%, 20%) and gives a whole 10 extra pts if you can show up to each time he gives a "quiz" Just study the practice tests in the textbook as they're similar in nature to the ones he gives and ask questions if you need help. (He can't help if you don't want to be helped..)
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Confusing test questions, had to study more than an average econ class. His extra credit quizzes do add up to 10 extra points added onto your final grade. If you want to do well, read the book and do practice questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He only grades by 3 tests, there is no homework. The tests are each 25 questions and very difficult. He only has lectures and usually posts them online but the powerpoints are bad so go to class. The information is confusing and all over the place. He gives random bonus points in class that are one questions quizzes that he gives the answer to

comment: Mr. Estes is a pretty cool guy. However, he takes ECON1000 WAY too seriously, and I had to study way harder than anyone else I knew taking the same class with different professors. He only lectures, and attendance is optional (besides test days). 3 tests make up the entire grade, with 5 bonus quizzes for EC. I had Bs on all my tests and got an A.
